headline.main: SIX ISSUES TAKEN OFF LIST; Stock Exchange Reports Also Addition of Uruguayan Bonds.
BOND PRICES RISE ON STOCK EXCHANGE; South American Issues Rally, Recovering Most of the Recent Losses.

docs.snippet: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15.--Following is an uncensored dispatch received from an important Brazilian city.
docs.lead_paragraph: BUENOS AIRES, Oct. 15.--Following is an uncensored dispatch received from an important Brazilian city.
docs.abstract: 1st uncensored news from loyal area; situation grave; Sao Paulo panic-stricken

headline.main: FIRST UNCENSORED NEWS FROM BRAZIL'S LOYAL AREA REVEALS GRAVE SITUATION; SAO PAULO LOOTERS' GOAL Rich City Panic-Stricken by Report Rebel Officers Tempt Men With It. LIBERAL RISING ALSO LOOMS Only 100 Police Left in Town-- Reserves Report Slowly-- American Autos Seized. WASHINGTON AIDS FEDERALS Stimson Approves War Purchases Here--Navy OrdersCruiser Near the Scene. Sao Paulo Fears Looting. UNCENSORED NEWS FROM LOYAL BRAZIL Time Limit Expires For Reserves. Federals Revise Reports. Rebels Claim a Victory. Prisoners Arriving in Rear. Rebels Claim Another Victory.

byline.original: Special Cable to THE NEW YORK TIMES. All Rights Reserved

headline.main: FREES NINE ANARCHISTS.; Uruguayan Judge Releases Men Who Escaped From Ship.

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Oct. 17.--A special train, carrying the 300 rebel prisoners captured in the fight at Itarare yesterday, when the rebels were beaten off, arrived here today. For the most part the prisoners were badly clothed and ill-fed, and were green...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Oct. 17.--A special train, carrying the 300 rebel prisoners captured in the fight at Itarare yesterday, when the rebels were beaten off, arrived here today. For the most part the prisoners were badly clothed and ill-fed, and were green troops, hastily recruited among the civilians of Rio Grande do Sul. There were also a number of impressed foreigners who had just arrived in the country.
docs.abstract: Fighting in Itarare; Govt spurns Coste's offer to end hostilities; S S Pensacola sent to Brazil

headline.main: FIGHTING IN BRAZIL CENTRES ON ITARARE; Heavy Federal Barrage of Fire, With Bombs From Planes, Beats Bact Rebels. CAPITAL REJECTS PEACE Costa's Offer to End Hostilities Is Spurned--Washington Sends Cruiser to Brazil. Calls for Federal Surrender. FIGHTING IN BRAZIL AROUND ITARARE Peace Offer Rejected. Rebel Victory Reported.

byline.original: Wireless to THE NEW YORK TIMES

headline.main: PERU'S BUSIEST BODY IS SANCTIONS COURT; Revolutionary Tribunal Will Hear Anybody Denounce Anybody Else. FACES A STUPENDOUS TASK Denunciation of Legula for High Treason Most Sensational Case So Far Filed. A Typical Product. Admit Leguia Denunciation. Treaties Still Stand.

byline.original: Special Correspondence, THE NEW YORK TIMES

docs.snippet: SAO PAULO, Oct. 18.--The occupation of four small towns in Southwestern Minas Geraes by Federal troops, with little resistance given by the rebels, and an increasing dissatisfaction throughout Minas Geraes with the revolutionary leaders, were...
docs.lead_paragraph: SAO PAULO, Oct. 18.--The occupation of four small towns in Southwestern Minas Geraes by Federal troops, with little resistance given by the rebels, and an increasing dissatisfaction throughout Minas Geraes with the revolutionary leaders, were announced in a communique issued by the Minister of Justice in Rio deJaneiro today.
docs.abstract: Federals take 4 towns; rebels suppress lighthouses; Pereira de Souza authorizes $10,000,000 paper issue for war purposes

headline.main: 4 BRAZILIAN TOWNS TAKEN BY FEDERALS; Communique Reports Victories in Minas Geraes--Rebels Announce General Attack. $10,000,000 PAPER ISSUED President Authorizes Sum for War Purposes--Southern Lighthouses Suppressed. Protracted Struggle Foreseen. South Most Important. General Offensive Reported. Rebels Suppress Lighthouses.
